intro: Trichoscypha heterophylla, commonly known as the African sandalwood, is a deciduous tree native to tropical Africa. It belongs to the family Burseraceae and is characterized by its smooth, greyish bark and compound leaves. The plant produces small, yellowish flowers followed by spherical, woody fruits containing aromatic seeds. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in lowland rainforests. Due to its fragrant wood, it has historical significance in traditional medicine and perfumery.
